revised_title: Spectroscopic Studies on Gaseous Explosions: Exploring the Flash of Combining Gases
tldr: The authors investigate the spectrum of gaseous explosions, specifically the flash of hydrogen and oxygen in a Cavendish eudiometer. They observe the presence of various spectral lines, including those of sodium, calcium, and iron, and discuss the possible sources of these lines. The study also explores the effects of introducing different substances and compounds into the explosion chamber.
